The sharp sicilian defense begins.
2.a3? At first I looked at this move and thought it was a time wasting move so
I just play naturally. Although the pawn push a3 looks innocuous, it's actually part of a deeper plan.
Here is the gambit. White sacrifices his b pawn to be able to play c3 and d4 striking the centre. This is similiar to an evans gambit.
I accept it as it's really the only option.
